description: UMD 4.7.1 is an emergency fix release of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CREAM on CentOS7 and SL6, which got broken with updates to bouncycastle and canl-java in UMD 4.7.0.&nbsp;<div><br><div><b>Please carefully read the <a href="https://cream-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Releases.html">CREAM release notes</a>&nbsp;as there are some workarounds to be applied after installing CREAM on SL6.&nbsp;</b></div></div>
releaseNotes: This release of CREAM fixes some issues with the latest version of Bouncycastle, CAnL and VOMS published in EPEL<br/><div>Please carefully read the&nbsp;<a href="https://cream-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Releases.html">CREAM release notes</a>&nbsp;as there are some workarounds to be applied after installing CREAM on SL6.&nbsp;<br></div>
installationNotes: All products in UMD 4.7.1 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: For further information about the distribution, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: operations (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu/">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report.
knownIssues: Please visit <a style="color:#3465A4" href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-4:UMD-4.7.1">https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-4:UMD-4.7.1</a> for known issues.
changeLog: This release includes and update for CREAM that make the CREAM service fully compatible with the latest version of Bouncycastle, CAnL and VOMS published in EPEL.&nbsp;<br/><div>Please carefully read the&nbsp;<a href="https://cream-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Releases.html">CREAM release notes</a>&nbsp;as there are some workarounds to be applied after installing CREAM on SL6.&nbsp;<br></div>

products.name: infn.cream
products.description: The CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service is a simple, lightweight service for job management operation at the Computing Element (CE) level. CREAM accepts job submission requests (which are described with the same JDL language used to describe the jobs submitted to the Workload Management System) and other job management requests (e.g. job cancellation, job monitoring, etc). CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.
